So, I am not sure whether we should add a test ?

text:
Thank you for your PR.

This issue #1193 is under review with this PR #1430 FYI.
title: nan

text: Closing as superseeded by #1430
title: nan

text:
That's not the right approach: code in the RST file is not well tested
and hard to maintain. The approach that we are taking is to enrich the
example files with blocks of rich comments and trying to remove as much
as possible from the rst files.
title: nan

text: Ok, so the code in the rst file is not supposed to be run? And what is your opinion on the order of this part?
title: nan

text:
> Ok, so the code in the rst file is not supposed to be run?

I think that I'd like to move as much as possible out to a long tutorial
example, and reference that example. I think that the narrative parts of
the documentation should be as much as possible about high-level
concepts, and the code should be as much as possible in examples
referenced from the docs.

> And what is your opinion on the order of this part?

I am not sure that I love it :$. We can discuss that at a coffee break.
title: nan

text: consequently close this PR
title: nan

text:
This parameter should take only Nifti images and should be renamed from mask -> mask_img.

```mask_img : 3D Nifti1Image, optional```

Should be added a bit of documentation as,  "An optional brain mask, provided mask_img should not be empty."
title: (None, '', u'nilearn/plotting/find_cuts.py')

text:
We should be doing this on the top. First, checking if it is a valid Nifti image in 3D and second using _safe_get_data on mask image to convert to data numpy array. Rest should do the job by itself. Tell me if I miss something here ?

 I think this snippet should be added on top after ```data = _safe_get_data(img)``` at line 55.
```python
mask_img=check_niimg_3d(mask_img)
mask = _safe_get_data(mask_img)
```
title: (None, '', u'nilearn/plotting/find_cuts.py')

text:
In ```doc/building_blocks/manual_pipeline.rst```, we should change name ```dataset``` to ```haxby_dataset``` to be in consistent with the example ```examples/plot_decoding_tutorial.py``` we are pointing to. Sample code is a bit of mix of both names dataset and haxby_dataset.

Also, section "6.1.1.3. Masking the data: from 4D image to 2D array" should be moved to above "6.1.1.2. Loading non image data: experiment description". The reason is in between we have conditioning applied to the masked dataset (fmri_masked) restricting to face vs cat labels which is done before masking. This might confuse users if they have followed the code snippets. 

Any thoughts on this ? ping @GaelVaroquaux @bthirion
title: nan

text: Close PR after comment from @GaelVaroquaux in PR #1432

Error message can be seen here, https://travis-ci.org/nilearn/nilearn/jobs/218779100#L2729

text:
You should be using like this:
Step 1: I am trying to create mask

```python
fmri_gm_norm = '/home/brain/Downloads/Audrey_Vanhaudenhuise/T1/mni_icbm152_gm_tal_nlin_sym_09a.nii'
T1 = '/home/brain/Downloads/Audrey_Vanhaudenhuise/T1/T1.nii'

from nilearn.input_data import NiftiMasker
masker = NiftiMasker(mask_strategy='epi',
mask_args=dict(upper_cutoff=.9, lower_cutoff=.4,
opening=False))
masker.fit(fmri_gm_norm)
```
Step 2: and apply it to a T1 image
```python
# You should `fit` your mask image first and then should be using to transform
# your T1.

data = masker.transform(T1) 
```

Hope this helps.
title: nan

text: Thanks a lot,  it works :)
